title: Sherman Hill: Cheyenne - Laramie
description: All the grandeur of big-time, modern American freight railroading – bustling and constant action, tough grades, powerful diesels, majestic western scenery, and extraordinary history – come together on Union Pacific’s legendary Sherman Hill.
longDescription:
Experience all the grandeur of big-time, modern American freight railroading – bustling and constant action, tough grades, powerful diesels, majestic western scenery, and extraordinary history – come together on Union Pacific’s legendary Sherman Hill for Train Sim World 3

It’s a new dawn, it’s a new day, the Sherman Hill route now features the same volumetric skies and lighting as introduced in Train Sim World 3!

Celebrate American rail with the Train Sim World 3: US Super Bundle!

Sherman Hill stretches 58 miles between the classic railroad cities of Cheyenne and Laramie, Wyoming, crossing the Continental Divide at an elevation of 8,015 feet. One of the crowning achievements of America’s Transcontinental Railroad, the crossing of Sherman Hill was built in the early 1860s and ever since has been a mecca of American railroading at its best. 

Throughout the decades, Sherman Hill, with its tough 1.5 percent westbound grade across the Laramie Mountains, has been home to Union Pacific’s biggest and best motive power, with today’s third-generation, high-horsepower diesels hauling double stacks, autos, manifest freight, coal, and more. 

Climb aboard Union Pacific’s modern and potent 4,300-horsepower Electro-Motive SD70ACe and veteran 3,000-horsepower EMD SD40-2 to forward tonnage between sprawling yards at Cheyenne and Laramie. Included with the route are 7 types of modern freight equipment.

Choose how you want to play; operate trains, complete the route tasks, or simply pick a vantage point and watch the action unfold. Create your own experiences with the Scenario Planner and Livery Designer and share them on Creators Club. Whatever you choose to do, there's lots to see and experience in Train Sim World 3: Sherman Hill
